text.p: Shares were mixed on Tuesday on the Beirut Stock Exchange as one rose, one fell and five were steady of the seven listed companies.
Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce rose to $13.75 from $13.625 and Banque Audi was steady at $19.125. The LIBX bank index rose 0.46 percent to 119.02.
Solidere A shares were unchanged at $10.375 while B shares fell to $10.75 from $10.875. Total Solidere turnover fell sharply to 45,793 shares from 84,530.
Ciments Libanais and industrial pipemaker Eternit held steady at $1.1875 and $1.875 respectively with 1,500 and 2,000 shares changing hands.
Some 25,000 Ciment Libanais shares were traded in a block on the floor at $1.25.
The BLOM stock index fell 0.34 percent to 908.06 and the LISPI fell 0.02 percent to 84.44.
There was no trade in the two other listed firms: Ciments Blancs and Uniceramic.
Total BSE turnover was 99,126 shares for a value of $926,129 against 111,032 shares for a value of $1,239,403 last Thursday, the last day of trading before the Easter holiday.
